item.title: 'She hasn't aged! Twitter marvels at Alicia Silverstone's youthful looks as 41-year-old transforms into Cher from Clueless - and looks JUST like she did when starring in the 1995 movie
item.description: Twitter users are marveling at Alicia Silverstone's youthful looks after the 41-year-old transformed herself into Cher from Clueless for an appearance on Lip Sync Battle.
item.content:encoded:
Clueless star Alicia Silverstone caused quite the stir online when she reembodied her beloved character from the hit 1995 flick for an appearance on Lip Sync Battle - but it wasn't just the return of Cher Horowitz that had people talking.

The 41-year-old, who is set to appear on the upcoming new season of the show, set social media alight with her incredibly youthful looks, with many Clueless fans left marveling at the fact that Alicia looked almost identical to her appearance in the beloved movie - despite it being shot 23 years ago. 

Twitter user @CrazyButLuvable took to the micro-blogging site after watching a clip of the upcoming episode which will air June 14 and wrote: 'Has @AliciaSilv #aliciasilverstone aged at all?!? She literally looks exactly like she did in #Clueless & the @Aerosmith videos 23 years ago!! Such a beautiful woman, mother and actress! Love her so much!'   

While @NonStopPop shared: 'Seeing Alicia Silverstone wearing her iconic Cher outfit from CLUELESS in 2018 and not looking significantly different from how she looked 23 years ago is a little surreal. Not that I'm complaining, mind you...'

And @missodessa added: 'Ok so Alicia Silverstone still looks amazing'.  

And while she could have chosen to perform a 90s hit from the cult classic movie on stage, the mom-of-one instead played homage to rapper Iggy Azalea's 2014 hit Fancy, which in turn, saw the Australian take on the role of Cher in her music video.

In a clip of the episode released on Twitter, Alicia revealed that although she was nervous, she was looking forward to reprising her iconic role.

'There are a lot of things that could go wrong, but I think it's gonna be OK,' she says backstage — before the camera cuts to her sure-to-be-a-highlight-of-the-season performance. 

The camera then cuts to one of the show's hosts, Chrissy Teigen, who looks thrilled and shocked by the choice.

'A modern-day Cher, this is amazing!' Chrissy says. 

Alicia is just one of many stars set to appear in the new season of the show, which premieres on June 14.

Also slated are Mena Suvari, Derek Hough, Nicole Scherzinger, Deon Cole, Karrueche Tran, Melissa Gorga, and Ramona Singer — the latter of which performs Britney Spears' Oops... I Did it Again in a red catsuit.

An outspoke advocate for veganism for years, Alicia credits a vegan diet with helping her stay in shape and in 2011, she released The Kind Diet: A Simple Guide to Feeling Great, Losing Weight, and Saving the Planet, a book containing personal insights about why she is sworn off meat and dairy forever. 

Alicia also runs her website The Kind Life, and says it's an 'interactive extension' of her book featuring recipes, nutritional information from doctors and tips about eating out.
item.dc:abstract: Twitter users are marveling at Alicia Silverstone's youthful looks after the 41-year-old transformed herself into Cher from Clueless for an appearance on Lip Sync Battle. In a teaser clip, the committed vegan who credits the lifestyle with keeping her in shape, can be seen performing Iggy Azalea's song Fancy, while wearing a slightly updated version of Cher's much-loved yellow plaid skirt suit. In the music video for Fancy, Iggy recreates several scenes from the 1995 movie Clueless, dressed as Alicia's character Cher Horowitz.

item.title: Kensington Palace shares a snap of the VERY cute cards sent to mark Harry and Meghan's wedding, Prince Louis' birth and Charlotte's birthday - and they've received 36,000 in the last month alone
item.description: Kensington Palace has released a photo showing some of the adorable handmade cards received by members of the Royal Family in the last month alone.
item.content:encoded:
Kensington Palace has released a photo showing some of the adorable handmade cards received by members of the Royal Family.

The image, shared on the palace's official Instagram account on Tuesday, shows cards marking Harry and Meghan's wedding, Prince Louis's birth and Princess Charlotte's 3rd birthday.

The post also offered insight into the extraordinary volume of post sent to the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge and the Duke and Duchess of Sussex - revealing that 36,000 pieces have been received in the last month alone.  

The adorable hand-drawn cards were a hit on social media, with people describing them as delightful and cute. 

The most popular card seemed to be the one of the Duke and Duchess of Sussex, made from a selection of craft items.  

The Duke was seen with a bushy beard of ginger yarn while his spiky hair was strands of coloured string. 

Meanwhile the Duchess was given a stunning crown complete with flower applique. 

Instagram user lisaannkat posted: 'Omg look how super cute the pic is of the Duke and Duchess!'

While user srinivasan_varsha wrote: 'They're so beautiful. And that picture of Duke Harry and Duchess Meghan is an absoloutly delightful piece of art.'

Other cards celebrated the birth of Prince Louis, with one reading 'Welcome Prince Louis'.

Another colourful card depicted a young girl and seemed to be dedicated to Princess Charlotte's birthday. 

Kensington Palace handles affairs relating to the Duke and Duchess of Sussex and the Duke of Duchess of Cambridge and their children, Prince George, Princess Charlotte, and Prince Louis. 

Matters relating to Prince Charles and the Duchess of Cornwall are directed to Clarence House, while the Queen and the Duke of Edinburgh's administration is handled by Buckingham Palace.

Members of the public can contact the Royal Family by sending post to the different addresses. 

The Queen is shown almost all of her correspondence on a daily basis by one of her Private Secretaries, and is said to take a keen interest in the letters she receives.

How do you write to the Queen? 

The Queen is shown almost all of her correspondence on a daily basis by one of her Private Secretaries, and she takes a keen interest in the letters she receives. 

You can write to the Queen at the following address:

Her Majesty The Queen

Buckingham Palace

London SW1A 1AA

For a formal letter, you can start it with 'Madam' and close the letter with 'I have the honour to be, Madam, Your Majesty's humble and obedient servant'. 

However, you can write in whatever style you feel most comfortable with. 

But, it is important to remember that there are some letters the Queen will not respond to.   

As the constitutional Monarch, she won't intervene in any political or personal disputes, and, for security reasons, any unsolicited gifts which are sent to The Queen will not be accepted.
item.dc:abstract: An image shared on Kensington Palace's official Instagram account on Tuesday (right) shows cards marking Harry and Meghan's wedding (left), Prince Louis's birth and Princess Charlotte's 3rd birthday. The post (inset) also offered insight into the extraordinary volume of post sent to the Duke and Duchess of Cambridge and the Duke and Duchess of Sussex - revealing that 36,000 pieces have been received in the last month alone.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Linning

item.title: Embracing her married name already! Gwyneth Paltrow is pictured proudly wearing a hat with MRS. FALCHUK embroidered on the front during a pre-wedding girls' trip to Mexico
item.description: Gwyneth, 45, was photographed wearing a $150 personalized straw hat by Poolside Bags that has 'Mrs. Falchuk' splashed across the front.
item.content:encoded:
Gwyneth Paltrow and her fiancé Brad Falchuk have yet to say 'I do' — but she already considers herself Mrs. Falchuk.

The 45-year-old Goop founder was photographed wearing a personalized straw hat by Poolside that has 'Mrs. Falchuk' emblazoned across the front.

Gwyneth and her friends are thought to have ordered the customizable $150 hats for her bachelorette-style getaway in April, with Gwyneth proudly embracing her future married name during the pre-wedding vacation. 

On Monday, Poolside posted a never-before-seen photo of Gwyneth modeling her hat on its Instagram page with the caption: 'There are no words, only #Gwyneth @gwynethpaltrow.'

In the snapshot, Gwyneth is posed with her hands under her chin as she smiles for the camera. She is sporting a yellow swimsuit and dark sunglasses to shield her eyes from the sun.

The mother-of-two also has a delicate beaded bracelet on one wrist and what looks like a fitness tracker on the other. Her fingers appear to be bare aside for the pinky ring on her left hand. 

The snapshot was taken at the luxurious Four Seasons resort Costa Palmas in Los Cabos, Mexico, which seems to be her favorite new vacation spot. 

Gwyneth visited Costa Palmas with her closest friends in April for her 'hen weekend,' and she shared plenty of photos from the getaway.

The group of women come from all aspects of Gwyneth's life — from childhood pals to the 'mom friends' she made after the birth of her children. 

Actress Cameron Diaz and designer Stella McCartney were along the A-list stars who traveled to Mexico to celebrate Gwyneth's upcoming nuptials.

When they first arrived at the resort, the women were all wearing matching white robes embroidered with their initials, white sandals, and straw hats. 

They were also seen carrying matching $175 straw totes by Poolside. And the pre-wedding party are not the only A-listers who are known to be fans of the brand. 

In addition to Gwyneth, Stella, and Cameron, Poolside products have also been worn by the likes of Gigi Hadid, Reese Witherspoon, Molly Sims, Rachel Hilbert, and Ashley Benson.

The location had obviously been carefully picked by Gwyneth, who as Goop-readers will know, makes no secret of her love of luxury.

Only open a year, the 1000-acre private beachfront resort community boasts two miles of deserted white sands, upon which nestle private villas worthy of the A-list. While the resort's more modest rooms start at around $700, private oceanfront 5-bedroom villas cost up to $7,000 a night.

Gwyneth is such a fan of Costa Palmas that she returned with her fiancé a little over a month later.

She and Brad spent Memorial Day weekend at the resort, and she posted snapshots of herself on the beach and cuddled up to her beau in a lagoon. 

Gwyneth and Brad had a black tie engagement party at the Los Angeles Theater in April after she returned from her bachelorette party.   

From director Steven Spielberg to Gwyneth's actress pals Kate Hudson, Cameron Diaz, Jennifer Aniston, Julia Roberts, Liv Tyler, Reese Witherspoon, Demi Moore and comidian Chelsea Handler, the guest list was packed with A-list names.

Although their engagement party was a star-studded bash, Gwyneth recently said she and Brad won't have a massive wedding. 

The Iron Man actress, who was married to her first husband, Coldplay singer Chris Martin, for 13 years, opened up about her upcoming nuptials on the The Howard Stern Show.

When asked why she wanted to get married again, she said: 'I think that I would like to give it a proper shot. For myself there is something really beautiful about marriage.'

The mother-of-two then added: 'I think Brad is somebody who is extremely, you know, he's really intelligent and he's really emotionally intelligent, and I think he's a really good person to try this with. He's very self aware he has emotional security.'

Gwyneth and Chris have two children, Apple, 14, and Moses, 12. Brad also has two children, Brody and Isabella, from his 10-year marriage to Suzanne Bukinik, which ended in a divorce filing in March 2013. However they don't have any plans to expand their families. 

'Neither of us want more kids. We're on the same team,' Gwyneth explained.
item.dc:abstract: Gwyneth, 45, was photographed wearing a $150 personalized straw hat by Poolside Bags that has 'Mrs. Falchuk' splashed across the front. Gwyneth and her friends are thought to have ordered the customizable hats specifically for her bachelorette-style trip a few months ago. Gwyneth and her closest friends stayed at the luxurious Four Seasons resort Costa Palmas in Los Cabos, Mexico, for her 'hen weekend' in April. Less than two months later, she returned to Costa Palmas with her fiancé Brad Falchuk (inset and right) for Memorial Day weekend.

item.title: How to be more spontaneous: Expert shares her tips for embracing spur-of-the-moment fun - including swapping diaries with a friend and setting aside a 'no plans' day every WEEK
item.description: UK-based journalist Kamin Mohammadi has revealed eight steps everyone can take to bring more fun into their lives - and it's all down to being a little more Italian in their approach.
item.content:encoded:
Balancing a busy social life with other commitments can be a challenge, so it is of little wonder many of us rely on a schedule to squeeze everything in each week.

But most of us find this kind of 'over-planning' leaves little room for spur-of-the-moment fun.

A survey of 2,000 adults revealed 56 per cent of Britons feel they have lost all spontaneity.

Meanwhile a fifth admit they haven't popped out for an unplanned drink with friends in five months, according to the study by Italian spirits brand Aperol.

Fortunately UK-based journalist Kamin Mohammadi, author of Bella Figura: How to Live, Love, and Eat the Italian Way, has revealed eight steps everyone can take to bring more fun back into their lives - and it's all down to being a little more Italian in their approach. 

She said: 'In Italy, it's hard not to be immediately struck by their different approach to socialising. It's much more spur-of the-moment than in the UK, starting with a phone call on the day suggesting an aperitivo somewhere as the sun goes down. After that who knows. 

'Pre-planning creates a degree of expectation and build up, which can often lead to disappointment; whereas spur-of-the-moment fun is exciting, with no anticipation – releasing inhibitions to see where the evening will take you. This is something Italians do so well.

'The mind is liberated by not making plans weeks in advance, which is why the "Aperitivo Hour" in Italy is such a ritual, it could be a mere pause in the day or the beginning of one of those unexpected evenings, where it is all about pleasure not pressure.' Here, FEMAIL shares Kamin's tips in full... 

Plan a meet-up an hour in advance 

Just 8 per cent of the UK population describes themselves as spontaneous. Social expert Kamin advises taking a leap to change the situation.

She said: 'Call, don't text, a friend right now and arrange to meet in one hour for a drink – ciao, cosa fai adesso?'

Introduce 'No Plan Wednesday'

Set aside one day of the week where you leave yourself open to spur-of-the moment plans. 

Kamin said: 'Deliberately leave gaps in your diary for the possibility of spontaneous evenings, and see what you fancy on the day.'

Seek out al-fresco social spots 

Kamin said: 'Enjoy an al fresco drink in a sunny square, where conversations can be started and new friends can be made. Salute!'

Be friendly and open when you go out

Having friends who are also willing to be spontaneous is crucial if you want to adopt this more relaxed lifestyle. 

Kamin advises expanding your social circle by leaving yourself open to the possibility of meeting like-minded people when you're out and about.  

'Seek out new connections, approach people in group situations and welcome newcomers, the more the merrier,' she said. 'Who knows where it might take you?'

Make the most of long summer evenings

Kamin said: 'Make a list of 'Must Dos' for the next few months, then leave the rest of the diary blank, so you can make the most of the longer evenings and the joy of having no plans.'

Rely on strangers to guide you 

It can be difficult to think outside the box when you're not used to it, so why not pick up tips from other people? Try this fun game-like approach from Kamin:

'Next time you see a friend, walk into the nearest bar or café to your meeting spot and – after your first drink – ask the staff where you should head to next, and follow their direction to see where the night takes you.'

Rope in your friends 

Kamin said: 'Pledge allegiance to spontaneity and convince your friends to join you. As many as half of all Brits are tired of over planning but are too afraid to stop! It's easier if you are in it together'

Embrace the loss of control 

'Embrace the opportunity to try something new and unexpected,' Kamin said. 'But if you aren't ready to completely let go, why not let your partner / flatmate / of even your mum take over your diary for a few days and enjoy the surprises.'
item.dc:abstract: UK-based journalist Kamin Mohammadi (left) has revealed eight steps everyone can take to bring more fun into their lives - and it's all down to being a little more Italian in your approach. It comes after a survey of 2,000 adults revealed 56 per cent of Britons feel they have lost all spontaneity.
item.dc:creator: Stephanie Linning
item.mi:shortTitle: The EIGHT steps to take if you want to be more spontaneous

item.title: 'Everything hurt': 17-year-old boy who desperately tried to bulk up in the gym in order to 'catch up' with his dad and brother reveals his extreme weight lifting regime almost KILLED HIM
item.description: Jared Shamburger, 17, from Houston, Texas was diagnosed with a potentially fatal condition called rhabdomyolysis after an extreme 90 minute weight lifting workout left him nearly dead.
item.content:encoded:
A Texas teen has revealed how working out too much resulted in a potentially life-threatening illness.

Jared Shamburger, 17, from Houston, told CBS news affiliate KTRK that he started lifting weights at a gym and wanted to 'catch up' with his dad and older brother who have been weight lifting for years.

'I gotta catch up to them and get as big as them,' Jared said of his motivation. 'I have to go hard fast.'

However, after a particularly strenuous 90 minute workout, he experienced muscle soreness and swelling and felt 'super duper sore'. 

'Everything hurt. It hurt to the touch. It was swollen,' he added.

After doing some research online, his mom Judy discovered a condition called rhabdomyolysis, or rhabdo for short, which often comes on after severe physical exertion.

'The mama bear in me kind of took over and I called the pediatrician and said, "I really think my son has rhabdo,"' Judy explained. 

She was right and Jared was hospitalized for five days.

According to WebMD, the condition occurs when muscles are injured and they release their contents, including a muscle enzyme, into the bloodstream. 

The enzyme can harm the kidneys and can cause kidney failure and if not treated quickly enough, can lead to death.

The condition has three common symptoms which include muscle swelling, muscle weakness and dark urine.

'In extreme cases, it can also cause death,' Judy added.

Luckily, Jared is expected to make a full recovery and shared that he plans to get back to the gym soon, despite his frightening ordeal.

And Judy revealed that she's thankful Jared came to her with his symptoms right away instead of suffering in silence.

'If he hadn't caught it, if he hadn't told me, if we had just gone out of town about our way,' she said.

'I can't even imagine. And I don't want to, about what could have happened.'
item.dc:abstract: Jared Shamburger, 17, from Houston, Texas was diagnosed with a potentially fatal condition called rhabdomyolysis after an extreme 90 minute weight lifting workout left him nearly dead. Speaking to CBS news affiliate KTRK, Jared explained that he started lifting weights at a gym as he wanted to 'catch up' with his dad and older brother who have been weight lifting for years. However, when he experienced muscle soreness and swelling and felt 'super duper sore' his mom Judy did some research online and discovered that her son sounded like he was suffering from the potentially fatal condition. After calling his pediatrician, Jared was hospitalized for five days, however he is expected to make a full recovery.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Lankston
item.mi:shortTitle: Teen reveals how doing extreme workouts nearly killed him

item.title: Crown Princess Victoria of Sweden is joined by her husband and parents as the royals visit a new memorial paying tribute to the victims of the 2004 tsunami
item.description: Crown Princess Victoria of Sweden, 40, was joined by her parents and husband Prince Daniel, 44, at the memorial to the victims of the Boxing Day tsunami in Stockholm today.
item.content:encoded:
The Swedish royal family today visited a new memorial for the victims of the Boxing Day tsunami.

Crown Princess Victoria, 40, was joined by her husband Prince Daniel, 44, as she arrived at the memorial on the island of Skeppsholmen, in Stockholm.

King Carl XVI Gustaf, 72, and his wife Queen Silvia, 74, also paid their respects to the victims of the 2004 disaster.

Sweden was the worst hit European and western country by the disaster, with 543 nationals losing their lives when the tsunami struck South East Asia. 

As many as 20,000 Swedish tourists were thought to have been affected.

The disaster continues to have an enormous impact on the country and the new memorial, titled Gravitational Ripples, is the latest way of remembering those who died.

Based in Skeppsholmen, a picturesque and cultural island in Stockholm, the memorial consists of a series of maze-like spirals of grass. 

How many Swedish people died in the 2004 Boxing Day Tsunami? 

Over 230,000 people died when massive waves hit the coasts of the countries surrounding the Indian Ocean on Boxing Day in 2004.

Sweden was the most-hit foreign nation with 543 nationals dying.

As many as 20,000 Swedish tourists are believed to have been affected. 

The tsunami was a result of an underwater earthquake off the coast of Sumatra, Indonesia.

The worst hit countries were Indonesia, India, Thailand and Sri Lanka.

The tsunami hit many tourist resorts killing thousands of foreign nationals.

At the centre of the memorial is two sculptures.

One is a large oval piece that has the names of those who died in the tsunami engraved on it.

While a smaller sculpture on the site has an overview of the memorial.

The centre also provides space for visitors to leave candles and flowers. 

It is unclear if the memorial site has officially opened, but it was visited by a solemn looking royal family today. 

Dozens of people were in attendance and joined the Swedish royals in paying their respects.

The royals could be seen holding bunches of flowers as they made their way through the memorial.

Other Swedes trailing behind also clutched flowers. 

The 2004 Boxing Day Tsunami was a result of an underwater earthquake off the coast of Sumatra, Indonesia. 

Over 230,000 people died when huge waves crashed into coasts of a number of countries surrounding the Indian Ocean.

Countries worst hit by the disaster were Indonesia, India, Thailand and Sri Lanka.

The tsunami also struck several tourist resorts, killing thousands of foreign nationals.

King Carl XVI Gustaf, 72, and his wife Queen Silvia (left and inset together), 74, also paid their respects to the victims of the 2004 disaster. Sweden was the worst hit European and western country by the disaster, with 543 nationals losing their lives when the tsunami struck South East Asia.

item.title: Duchess of Cambridge and her sister Pippa have worn Kate Spade dresses bearing late designer's name - after she sold the label in 2006
item.description: The Duchess of Cambridge, 36, has stepped out in Kate Spade designs on a number of occasions, most recently at an event in London in November last year.
item.content:encoded:
The Duchess of Cambridge and her sister Pippa Middleton are among the high-profile women who have stepped out in Kate Spade dresses.

The late American designer, who was found dead in her New York apartment on Tuesday, co-founded her eponymous label with her husband in 1993 before eventually selling the business in 2006 to spend more time with her daughter.

However the label's clothing, accessories and homewear continue to bear her name, one that has become synonymous with the brand's distinctive girlish, sophisticated style.

The Middleton sisters have both been spotted in Kate Spade creations in the years since the designer left the business, a sign of the label's continued influence and importance in the fashion world. 

Kate Middleton, 36, has opted for Kate Spade dresses for a number of occasions, most recently at an event in London in November last year. 

The figure skimming-dress featured an all over diamond print with contrasting striped waistband and cuffs, a perfect choice for the then-pregnant royal. 

Months earlier Kate was seen in a pair of red chandelier earrings by the brand as she attended the opening of the musical 42nd Street on the West End in April 2017.

The duchess also chose a Kate Spade dress for an outing at an event to promote World Mental Health Day in October 2016.

Meanwhile Pippa, 34, liked the label's classic, feminine style so much she packed two different frocks for her Australian honeymoon with husband James Matthews in May 2017.

The younger Middleton sister has also been spotted with bags by the label a number of times over the years. 

Kate Spade, 55, was found dead inside her Manhattan apartment on Tuesday following an apparent suicide. She left a note telling her teenage daughter that it was not her fault before taking her own life.

She was discovered 'unconscious and unresponsive' by her housekeeper inside her bedroom. 

Kate and her husband launched their design line back in 1993, starting at first with just handbags before expanding to clothes and other accessories.

Three years in the couple was able to open their first store, and for the next decade continue to grow the company.

She has launched international and home lines by 2004, having by that point sold off most of her company.

Neiman Marcus purchased 56 percent of the company in 1999 and the remaining 44 percent by 2006, at which time Kate left the business to raise her daughter.

Andy continued to work with brands including Target, J.Crew and Warby Parker.

By 2006, the company was valued at $125 million, and Kate left for good the following year after Neiman sold Kate Spade & Co to Liz Claiborne that same year.

In the decade since she sold her ownership Kate Spade has continued to grow, and in 2017 the brand was purchased by coach for an astonishing $2.4 billion.

UK: For confidential support in the UK, call the Samaritans on 116123 or visit a local Samaritans branch, see samaritans.org for details. 

US: If you or anyone you know needs to talk, the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline is available 24/7 at 1-800-273-TALK (8255)
item.dc:abstract: Kate and Pippa Middleton have both been spotted in Kate Spade creations in the years since the designer left the business in 2006, a sign of the label's continued influence and importance in the fashion world. Kate Spade, 55, was found dead in her New York apartment on Tuesday following an apparent suicide. Pictured l-r: Kate Middleton in a Kate Spade dress in London; in a pair of earrings by the brand on the West End (inset); in London while pregnant in November last year; and Pippa in one of two Kate Spade dresses she wore on her honeymoon.

item.title: Back in the Big Apple! Ivanka Trump shows off her flawless complexion as she goes make-up-free while catching up with friends Wendi Deng and Hugh Jackman, before visiting her favorite New York City salons
item.description: Ivanka, 36, was seen chatting with Hugh, 49, and his wife, Deborra-lee Furness, 62, in the doorway of their Greenwich Village apartment on Monday evening.
item.content:encoded:
Ivanka Trump was seen catching up with her friends Hugh Jackman and Wendi Deng Murdoch while in New York City on Monday evening.

The 36-year-old first daughter donned a $1,850 sleeveless cream dress from Proenza Schouler, and a pair of black slingback heels for her night out in the Big Apple.

Ivanka gave Hugh, 49, and his wife, Deborra-lee Furness, 62, a hug and a kiss as she walked out of their Greenwich Village apartment building with a friend.

Scroll down for video 

Hugh and Deborra-lee had their dogs with them, and Ivanka bent down to pat one of the pooches on the head a she made her way out of the building. 

The actor and first daughter have been pals for years; in 2015, Hugh posted an image of Ivanka on his Twitter account, referring to her as his 'lovely friend'.

Ivanka wore minimal make-up for the outing, and her long blonde hair was parted in the middle and loose around her shoulders. 

The mother-of-three topped off her look with a pin on the bodice of her dress, a gold bracelet, and a red string tied around her left wrist.  

Though she hasn't spoken about the purpose of the string, which she has been wearing off and on for about a year, it does bear a resemblance to the type of red string that Kabbalah practitioners wear to ward off the 'evil eye.' 

Ivanka carried a black handbag as she and her friend made their way to the SUV waiting outside the apartment building. 

After the first daughter got into her vehicle, Hugh and Deborra-lee took their dogs outside while chatting with friends who were also leaving the building.

Wendi, 49, trailed out behind them, and Deborra-lee waved at her to say hello; after Wendi had caught up with them, Deborra-lee threw her arm around her before she got into her own car.

The businesswoman donned a ruffled blazer, skinny pants, and black wedge mules for the evening out.

Hugh and Deborra-lee were dressed more casually to walk their pets. Hugh had on a dark button-down top and dark pants, while his wife opted for a black tunic and loose-fitting black pants. 

The next day, Ivanka was seen leaving the side entrance of her New York City apartment to evade the photographers waiting outside her door. 

The White House senior adviser, who was born and raised in Manhattan, looked chic in a black hooded jacket, black skinny pants, and knee-high black boots.

She wore aviator sunglasses and added a pop of color to her look by sporting a red lip. 

Ivanka was seen getting inside an SUV parked in front of her apartment as she made her way to Oon Arvelo Salon and then Oscar Blandi Salon.

The first daughter has been a longtime client of stylist Peter Oon, and she has been getting her hair dyed by Kyle White, lead colorist at Oscar Blandi, for the past couple of years.  

Although it is unclear who did what, Ivanka likely spent a good portion of the day getting her hair done; she did, however, find time to pay tribute to designer Kate Spade, who committed suicide, and was found on Tuesday morning. 

Ivanka took to Twitter shortly after the news of Kate's death broke, writing: 'Kate Spade's tragic passing is a painful reminder that we never truly know another's pain or the burden they carry. If you are struggling with depression and contemplating suicide, please, please seek help.'

While she was in her old stomping ground, her 37-year-old husband, Jared Kushner, was seen leaving their Washington, D.C. home at about 7:30 a.m. as he made his wy to work. 

It's unclear when she arrived in New York City, but the getaway comes on the heels of her family trip to Camp David.

Ivanka, Jared, and her siblings Donald Jr. and Tiffany traveled to the president's retreat in Maryland with their father, President Donald Trump, on Friday.

The first daughter looked incredibly chic in her safari-inspired outfit when she headed to Camp David, but her belted wide-leg trousers were so long they were dragging on the grass.

She was wearing a classic white blouse tucked into a pair of $1,490 Oscar de la Renta high-waisted pants when she boarded Marine One with her family in the afternoon.

Standing just an inch shy of six feet, Ivanka is far from short, but her designer pants appeared to be a few inches too long — even with her sky-high heels.

Photos of Ivanka walking across the South Lawn of the White House on Friday with her husband, Jared, show her long pants dragging across the grass as she made her way to Marine One.

It's likely that her heels were sinking into the ground during the walk across the lawn, and while she ended up walking on her trousers, she didn't seem to be worried about grass stains or tripping on her hem.

Ivanka was smiling brightly while walking hand-in-hand with Jared as they boarded the helicopter together.
item.dc:abstract: Ivanka, 36, was seen chatting with Hugh, 49, and his wife, Deborra-lee Furness, 62, in the doorway of their Greenwich Village apartment on Monday evening. Hugh and Deborra-lee were on their way out to walk their dogs, and Ivanka gave them each a hug and a kiss in the doorway of the building (bottom inset). The first daughter was joined by Wedni, 49, who also stopped to say hello to the couple. The next day, Ivanka left her New York City apartment (top inset) and visited both Oon Arvelo Salon and Oscar Blandi Salon.
item.dc:creator: Erica Tempesta
item.mi:shortTitle: Ivanka Trump catches up with Hugh Jackman and Wendi Deng in NYC

item.title: Returning the favor! Danny DeVito, 73, takes a cardboard cutout of a 17-year-old girl to the set of his hit sitcom It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia - after she took one of HIM to her prom
item.description: On May 11, 17-year-old Allison Cross attended her prom in Carlisle, PA with a cutout of DeVito. This week, the actor posed on the set of It's Always Sunny with a cardboard cutout of Allison.
item.content:encoded:
Weeks after a Pennsylvania high school senior took a cardboard cutout of Danny DeVito to prom, the actor took the teenager out on a date, too — sort of.

On May 11, 17-year-old Allison Cross attended the Carlisle High School prom, bringing along a lifesize cardboard cutout of the 73-year-old It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia star.

Her unconventional date went viral and made national news, eventually catching the attention of the real Danny DeVito, who decided to get in on the joke.

Back in May, WHTM-TV reported on how Allison chose her two-dimensional prom date, publishing photos of the teenage Always Sunny fan posing with the cutout and smiling next to him while friends milled about nearby.

She wore a blue ruffled dress for the occasion, and pulled a tie out of her brother's closet to drape around 'Danny's' neck. She also bought him a boutonniere to match her own corsage.

Over three weeks later, though, the joke has taken on new life. On May 4, DeVito's It's Always Sunny co-star Rob McElhenney took to Instagram to share some new pictures.

'Hey Allison,' he wrote. 'I heard you took cardboard Danny to Prom. What a coincidence. He took cardboard Allison to Paddy’s...'

In the post, he included one of Allison's photos — as well as one of DeVito on the show's set, hanging out at the bar.

DeVito looks amused, pointing to a lifesize cutout of Allison in her light blue prom dress.

Soon after it was posted, Allison herself saw the image, tweeting her disbelief: 'I am shooketh.'

'Thank you SO, SO MUCH @RMcElhenney and @DannyDeVito for fulfilling my dream of visiting Paddy’s Pub from @alwayssunny!!' she added.

Interestingly, the whole thing almost didn't happen. Allison told the New York Post back in May that she'd considered other celebrities for her date, including Bill Nye the Science Guy.

'But many of them would [have required] ordering a custom-made cutout, and I’m not about that money life, if you know what I’m saying,' she said, adding that she she found a 'shockingly wide variety' of premade cardboard cutouts of the 'hilarious' DeVito already for sale on Amazon.

She spent $100 on the cutout itself, and duct-taped it to a $20 plastic scooter so she could pull him around with a leash.

In addition to earning her fans online, Allison's cutout date was also a hit with classmates, who lined up to take photos with him. But she admitted that she wouldn't let anyone else dance with the cutout, because she was worried he would get broken.

'Making things work with a human date can be so exhausting,' she told the Post. 'Danny’s not like that. He just goes with the flow . . . We never argue, never fight.

'Plus, he treats me the way a woman should be treated.'

In the fall, Allison plans on attending Gettysburg College to major in film and media studies, but it looks like she is already quite media savvy. After prom, she made a video about the experience, which she shared on her YouTube channel. 

In the clip, she explained how the whole idea came about, noting that she was 'having trouble finding a prom date.'

'It seemed like all the good guys were taken, and all the ones that weren't taken I wasn't really interested in,' she said. 'Until one day, I had this idea. What if I just bring a cardboard cutout of Danny DeVito to prom? So I did.' 

Knowing that stories like this end up on the news 'all the time,' Allison revealed that she had reached out to ABC News to see if they wanted to do a story on her.

After sending in photos and videos, she ended up making the local news, and her prom pictures quickly went viral. 

'This is like the highlight of my year,' she admitted.
item.dc:alternative: CARLISLE, Pa. (AP) - A Pennsylvania high school student took an unorthodox approach to prom and brought a cardboard cutout of actor Danny DeVito to the...
item.dc:abstract: In May, 17-year-old Allison Closs from Carlisle, Pennsylvania attended her high school prom with a lifesize cutout of DeVito. She spent $100 on the prop, which she found on Amazon, and added a tie and boutonniere. Images of the teen and her two-dimensional date went viral, eventually catching the attention of DeVito himself. This week, the 73-year-old actor posed for pictures with a cardboard cutout of Allison on the set of It's Always Sunny in Philadephia, which Allison is thrilled about.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Lankston

item.title: The perfect brand ambassador! Kim Kardashian wore all her own makeup on the CFDAs red carpet - but had her complexion prepped with $870 worth of skincare products and facials
item.description: Kim, 37, wore all makeup from her KKW Beauty cosmetics line adding up to $273 done by Mario Dedivanovic, 34, who first prepped Kim's skin using four Rodial products costing $369.
item.content:encoded:
Kim Kardashian proved her dedication to her own beauty brand when she arrived to the CFDAs wearing only makeup from her own KKW collection. 

The 37-year-old arrived wearing KKW Beauty products from head-to-toe which was done by her longtime makeup artist, Mario Dedivanovic for the occasion. 

Aside from her KKW makeup, Mario, 34, first prepped her skin using a host of products from high-end brand Rodial, applying a staggering $369 worth of skincare to her complexion before moving onto makeup. 

Mario shared that the inspiration for Kim's look was natural but glam, 'I wanted Kim to have her classic "Kim K Glam" look for the event and not veer too far off from what she is known for. To change it up a bit for the CFDAs, I added gloss to her lids and went for a darker lip than we normally go for,' he admitted.   

To get Kim's natural look, Mario started by using the $80 KKW Beauty Conceal Bake and Brighten Kit in Shade 7 and then set the concealer using the $18 Baking Powder in shade Bake 2.

Once that was applied, Mario began contouring Kim's face using the $18 KKW Beauty Creme Contour Sticks in Medium I and II - starting off by contouring her cheekbones, then her forehead and jawline.

After everything was blended and set with translucent powder, Mario added highlight to the cheekbones and cupid's bow using the new KKW Beauty Highlighter Palette in Palette I, ($44), then he used the Anastasia Beverly Hills Brow Wiz in Medium Brown ($21), to fill in her brows.

Mario decided a glossy brown eye would be perfect for the occasion so he used a smudge brush, buffed out the shade Loyalty from the $45 KKW x Mario Palette on the lash line to add definition then mixed both Armenia and Loyalty over the eyelids. 

To add a glossy finish, he used a small amount of the KKW x Mario Lipgloss ($18) in Super Nude over the shadow.

Then, he lined the lips using the new $12 KKW Beauty Lip Liner in Nude 2 which is not currently available but will be released June 8.

After blending the liner with a lip brush, he finished by applying the KKW Beauty Creme Lipstick in Nude 2, ($20). 

Before Mario even applied any of Kim's makeup, he began by prepping her face using products from skincare brand Rodial which added up to a total of $369. 

He used the $45 Rodial Dragons Blood Cleansing Water followed by the Rose Gold Moisturizer which costs a hefty $250 and treated her skin with $56 Vitamin C Brightening Pads and an $18 Vitamin C Sheet Mask.

Before the awards show Kim went to see Joanna Czech where she got a customized Oxylight Facial which consists of LED light therapy and negative ionization technology which increases collagen production and facials start at $500 and are 90 minutes long. 

The reality TV star received the Fashion Influencer at Monday night's CFDA Fashion Awards and she looked typically sexy as she arrived at Brooklyn Museum in New York in a cream crop top and long skirt by Rick Owens, which showed off her taut tummy and hinted at her equally-daring braless display.  

The mother-of-three looked sensational in the two-piece ensemble which accentuated her hourglass figure and adding some Egyptian-style metallic accents, Kim donned two chunky gold wrist cuffs and statement gold rings.

Kim's hair, which was coiffed by her close friend, celebrity hairstylist Chris Appleton, was pulled back into a high ponytail with plenty of volume and texture.  

The reality star's prestigious award comes after not only maintaining a social media following of over 200 million but also running multiple fashion and beauty brands.

Some of the star's ventures include: KKW Beauty, KKW Fragrance, Kids Supply, Kimoji, her app and site. 

And Kim began her acceptance speech with the quip: 'I'm kind of shocked i'm winning a fashion award when I'm naked most of the time.'
item.dc:abstract: Kim, 37, wore all makeup from her KKW Beauty cosmetics line to the the CFDA Awards, adding up to a total of $273. The mother-of-three's makeup was done by longtime artist and friend, Mario Dedivanovic. Mario, 34, first prepped Kim's skin using four Rodial products costing a whopping $369 altogether, but before Kim even applied makeup or skincare she got a $500 facial from Joanna Czech in NYC who used LED light therapy to boost Kim's collagen.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Lankston

item.title: 'It was really upsetting': Riverdale star Lili Reinhart denies pregnancy rumors again, as she admits her self esteem 'took a hit' after a 'bloated' photo of her sparked reports she is expecting
item.description: Lili attended the CFDA Awards Monday evening in New York City where she decided to answer questions on the red carpet about the pregnancy rumors.
item.content:encoded:
Lili Reinhart has shut down pregnancy rumors again one week after an 'unflattering' photo of herself circulated the internet and prompted some speculation that she was expecting.

The actress, 21, attended the Council of Fashion Designers of America (CFDA) Awards Monday evening in New York City where she decided to answer questions on the red carpet about the pregnancy rumors. 

'It was bugging me and at first it was really upsetting,' Lili told Entertainment Tonight. 'I'm 21—I'm not pregnant. I don't want people to think I'm pregnant if I'm not pregnant. It did take a hit to my self-esteem for a second and then I kind of picked myself back up and said, "I'm not going to let this ruin my day!"'

Lili also said that the people around her encouraged her to ignore the rumors instead of responding to them, but the star took a different approach. 

'I feel like a lot of people say you should just sweep it under the rug, don’t pay attention to it, but that’s never really been my style,' she said. 'Maybe some people find that obnoxious, whatever, but no, I felt the need to say, "No. I'm not pregnant."' 

The Riverdale actress first addressed the rumors on Instagram Stories last Monday. 

During the post, she denied she was pregnant and shared a body-positive message saying her body changes 'constantly', meaning she sometimes gets bloated.

Her message came after a photo of herself and rumored boyfriend and co-star Cole Sprouse, 25, taken in New Orleans, started circulating online, and caused some to speculate Lili was pregnant with her fellow Riverdale star's baby.

'It's unfortunate that one unflattering photo of my stomach circulating the internet causes hundreds of people to think that I'm pregnant. Nope. Not pregnant. This is just my body,' Lili, who plays Betty Cooper in the popular CW series, wrote in her response.

'And sometimes I'm bloated. Sometimes an unflattering photo is taken of me. Sometimes I go through periods of time where I gain weight.'

She used her post as an opportunity to remind others that their bodies, too, might experience similar changes, urging them to practice self-acceptance.

'My body is something that I will NEVER apologize for. My body will constantly go through change. And so will yours,' she added.

'And that's fine.

'So let's not put to much time and effort into caring about a stranger's figure.'

Her co-star Camila Mendes, 23, chimed in with an update of her own, saying Lili had 'inspired' her to speak out too. 

'I feel bloated 24/7, my weight fluctuates constantly, it comes with being a woman and should be celebrated, not criticized.' Camila, who plays Veronica Lodge on Riverdale, wrote on her own Instagram Story.

'I used to fear the day that people start publicly criticizing my body and commenting on my weight. 

'I've suffered too much from my own self-criticism, and wasn't sure that I could handle it from others.

'But seeing somebody as beautiful as Lili respond to public scrutiny by preaching and practicing self-love is all it takes for me to overcome that fear.

'Proud to call her my friend. Let's continue inspiring women to love their bodies.'

While Lili and Cole have never explicitly confirmed that they are dating, they have been spotted looking loved up in the past.

Last month, the pair were seen kissing and holding hands in Paris, France, and in January, they were photographed enjoying a beach vacation in Hawaii together.

Lili declined to confirm a possible relationship in an interview that same month, telling V Magazine: 'I'm not at a point in my life where I'm ready to openly confirm, deny, or talk about a relationship that I'm in, because I think it's brutal to have a relationship in the spotlight where I can be scrutinized by anyone and everyone.

'Being in a relationship with someone, it's a relationship between those two people, and I feel like when you let enough people in, it's not about those two people anymore. It's about everyone.'

Lili has opened up about body image on social media in the past. Just last week, she talked openly about her long battle with cystic acne. 

In a powerful Instagram Story, the actress walked fans through the emotional experience of going to an all-day photoshoot while dealing with a breakout of spots on her face. 

'I have a cystic breakout on my forehead currently. And I had to do a photoshoot all day long,' she wrote. 'I've had cystic acne since I was 12. And it has caused major self esteem issues ever since.'

On this particular day, Lili was forced to 'put [her] biggest insecurity on display'.

She wrote: 'There was nowhere to hide. 20+ people were studying my face on the camera monitor at any given time during the 11-hour shoot. And all I could think about when I was in front of the camera were the pimples on my forehead.' 

The stunning star revealed that she tends to text her mother when she has a breakout to vent about how 'ugly I feel' and admitting that 'I'm not sure if or when I'll ever be able to accept my skin as it is.'

However, she said, 'I'm hoping that someday I can feel beautiful even if I'm having a breakout. And that I won't feel obsessive or paranoid.'

Lili has made the headlines a number of times for her incredibly candid approach to talking about her skin conditions. In her post she explains feeling a 'need' to talk about it.'

'Because maybe if I normalize my skin, more people... including myself... will be able to feel okay about their skin.  

'My breakouts don't define me. To anyone out there who feels embarrassed or ashamed by breakouts... I feel you. We have each other so let's get through this acne experience together.'   

Lili has previously explained that she started developing 'really bad acne' when she was in the seventh grade, and nearly a decade later she is still dealing with breakouts. 

'I developed slight body dysmorphia — when I would break out, I couldn't look at myself in the mirror for a couple of months at a time,' she told Seventeen. 

'I remember doing my make-up before school in the dark, which is an awful idea, but it's because I didn't want to see myself in that bright light.' 

Last month, Lili also gave her followers an honest look into her skincare routine by sharing a photo of herself fresh-faced with pimple cream dotted all over her face. 

'Tinder profile: Hi I'm Lili. I'm 21, a Virgo, Cali-Girl. And I have cystic acne. Hmu,' Lili joked in the post.

It did take a hit to my self-esteem for a second and then I kind of picked myself back up and said, "I'm not going to let this ruin my day!"' This came after a photo of herself and rumored boyfriend and co-star Cole Sprouse, 25, taken in New Orleans, started circulating online (left), and caused some to speculate Lili was pregnant with her fellow Riverdale star's baby.

item.title: Colouring-in for grown ups! Crayola launches a MAKE-UP range – including 'face crayons', eyeshadow palettes and a brush set
item.description: The brand, best known for its kids' colouring crayons, has unveiled its 58-piece cosmetics range, available exclusively at UK-based online retailer ASOS. The make-up crayons come in an array of colours.
item.content:encoded:
Crayola has launched a new make-up collection - which includes 'face crayons', lipsticks and eyeshadow palettes.

The brand, best known for its kids' colouring crayons, has unveiled its 58-piece cosmetics range, available exclusively at online retailer ASOS. 

The make-up crayons come in an array of colours, ranging from blue to orange, while bright mascara is also on offer.

Prices range from £9 for a face crayon, to £25 for a make-up brush set.   

The make-up collection also includes highlighters, lip palettes and face palettes, with all the items being cruelty-free.

The limited edition Color Crayon Trio even comes in the familiar yellow and green packaging that regular Crayola crayons come in.

It is actually not the first time that Crayola has ventured into the beauty world.

Earlier this year, Crayola teamed up with Sally Hansen to create a range of nail polishes.

The launch comes after young girls were warned against using regular Crayola pencils as eyeliner in 2015.  

Beauty vloggers offered their fans tutorials on the best way to utilise the pencils in place of eyeliner.

The bizarre trend involved dipping the colouring pencils in water, before applying on the face.  

At the time, Crayola advised against the pencils being used as make-up because they were not 'designed, tested or approved for this purpose'.
item.dc:abstract: The brand, best known for its kids' colouring crayons, has unveiled its 58-piece cosmetics range, available exclusively at UK-based online retailer ASOS. The make-up crayons come in an array of colours, ranging from blue to orange (left and right), while bright mascara is also on offer. The collection also includes a brush set (top) and a lip palette (bottom).

item.title: 'It's about self expression': Woman, 24, spends THREE HOURS a day turning herself into a living doll - and she loves the look so much she even had fake toy joints TATTOOED on her knees
item.description: Makeup artist and hair stylist, Toshi Salvino,24, of Brooklyn, New York, has been fascinated by dolls and the Harajuku style for most of her life.
item.content:encoded:
A woman who has spent most of her life fascinated by figurines and the Harajuku style has transformed herself into a living art doll complete with bright pink hair and over the top makeup that takes hours a day to do.  

Makeup artist and hair stylist, Toshi Salvino, 24, of Brooklyn, New York, plans out three hours a day to become her doll self and wears her full doll look four to six days a week. 

Toshi, who is originally from Pennsylvania, said that her eccentric look is about self expression and using her body as a canvas so she can convey how she's feeling on any given day. 

Scroll down for video 

She said: 'I think my look is really about self expression and I like being a doll because that means I can be whatever I want that day. I am pretty much using my body as the canvas to express how I am feeling.'

'I would like to say that I am a mix up of whimsical fairy tale Harijuku fashion that stemmed from goth, and is running into neon lights, leaving a trail of glitter because I do that in real life!'

'I like to bring other people into my imaginary world with me and I'm glad that I can do that through putting stuff on my face.'

As a child Toshi found others who dressed the way she did while flipping through Japanese fashion magazines. And since then, she said their style has helped shape her own unconventional looks.

'I was nine years old or something and I found Fruits Magazine. I was like, "Oh my God there are people who dress like me!" Seeing that as a kid made me really think it's okay to keep doing what you're doing, there is someone out there who gets this and so ever since that, Japan and Harajuku fashion has been super important to me.'

Growing up in the 'middle of nowhere' Pennsylvania, Toshi was always told to tone down her style but now that she's living in New York, she said it's normal to dress in an alternative way, which is one of her favorite things about the city.   

The artist shares her love of alternative fashion with twins and best friends Juliana and Alexandra Abene who desribed Toshi has a 'fantasy'. 

She said: 'She is what we want to see in the world. It's all so dreary so when you meet someone like her you want to hold her, you want to hold on because she's just a light and it's wonderful we have that in our lives.'  

Juliana added: 'Yeah, especially in New York where everybody is like, I mean look at me, everybody is all black all the time - literally me - so to see something like that is like so exciting.'

Toshi's look requires her to carefully apply colorful eyeshadows and white liner to create the illusion of wide, doll-like eyes. 

She also keeps her hair in ever-changing shades of rainbow but she recently took her appearance one step further with the addition of doll joints, complete with screws, tattooed on her knees - she even plans to add matching joints on her elbows.

Toshi said: 'My tattoos, I've wanted them for a really long time. Aesthetically they're doll joints on the knees with screw hinges, which is really meaningful - obviously my whole living doll style is appropriate but also, I have Lyme disease, which is kind of like having arthritis in your entire body.' 

'The thing that affects me the most, and is the most painful and probably the most hindering besides my hands, is my knees. So I feel like the screw through the knee is an accurate representation of how it feels sometimes.'

'After getting the tattoos I feel like even with no makeup I can still carry on my doll persona regardless, whereas in the past I wouldn't really feel like myself without having makeup on.' 

Toshi currently works at the Hello Beautiful Salon in Williamsburg with manager Rebecca Faye who said the salon was the perfect environment for Toshi 'to be herself'. 

Rebecca said: 'The vibe of the salon is why she came to us because it's just full of art, beauty, glitter and lots of hair colors too, so it suited her. It has all the elements she needs to survive. She could be herself here.'

Toshi added: 'If I didn't become a hair stylist, then I would just be some weird hermit, recluse artist, painting alone with cats. Nothing wrong with that but I like to make the colorful magic happen.'

Toshi also regularly performs as a doll or a cyborg for club nights and said she loves using her role as a living art doll to spread light and laughter

She said: 'If a little kid sees me and they think that I'm a fairy and they think fairies are real, then that makes me so happy!' 

'I hope that they believe in themselves enough to become one if they want to. I just kind of want to prove that you can do whatever you want and be confident.'
item.dc:abstract: Makeup artist and hair stylist, Toshi Salvino of Brooklyn, New York, has been fascinated by dolls and the Harajuku style for most of her life. And to live out her 'doll life,' she plans out three hours a day to become her doll self and wears her full doll look four to six days a week. She said: 'I think my look is really about self expression and I like being a doll because that means I can be whatever I want that day. I am pretty much using my body as the canvas to express how I am feeling.' She added that her style is a mix up of 'whimsical fairy tale Harijuku fashion that stemmed from goth, and is running into neon lights, leaving a trail of glitter'.

item.title: Dapper Prince Charles is joined by the Duchess of Cornwall as he steps in for his mother the Queen to host a garden party at Buckingham Palace
item.description: Prince Charles, 69, was joined by his wife the Duchess of Cornwall, 70, and sister Princess Anne, 67, for the Buckingham Palace reception honouring hundreds of community leaders.
item.content:encoded:
Prince Charles stepped in for his mother the Queen to host a garden party at Buckingham Palace on Tuesday. 

The royal, 69, was joined by his wife the Duchess of Cornwall, 70, and sister Princess Anne, 67, for the reception honouring hundreds of community leaders.  

The royals looked in excellent spirits as they mingled with guests in the grounds of the palace, with all three stopping to chat with small groups of people.

Supporters stood in crowds four-deep in the hope of catching a glimpse of Charles and jostled for position to take photos as he walked past. 

It is the third garden party hosted at Buckingham Palace so far this summer, with two more scheduled for June and July.

The Queen was on hand to welcome guests to the first two receptions however Prince Charles has long been scheduled to represent his mother at today's event. 

There is one more garden party scheduled to take place at Holyrood Palace next month.  

Charles looked dapper in a grey morning suit, which he wore with a top hat and powder pink tie. 

While it was a sunny afternoon in London, Charles still came prepared with a black umbrella. 

Meanwhile his sister Anne was very much dressed for the sunshine, stepping out in a pair of wrap around shades.   

Over the course of each year, The Queen welcomes over 30,000 guests to spend a relaxed summer afternoon in the beautiful gardens of Buckingham Palace or the Palace of Holyroodhouse. 

The garden parties serve are an important way for The Queen to speak to a broad range of people from all walks of life, all of whom have made a positive impact in their community.

At each Garden Party, around 27,000 cups of tea, 20,000 sandwiches and 20,000 slices of cake are consumed.
item.dc:abstract: Prince Charles, 69, was joined by his wife the Duchess of Cornwall (left together), 70, and sister Princess Anne, 67, for the Buckingham Palace reception honouring hundreds of community leaders. The royals looked in excellent spirits as they mingled with guests in the grounds of the palace (top right), with all three stopping to chat with small groups of people. The invitees were also treated to a march past by the beefeaters (bottom right).

No wonder they can't afford a deposit! Under 35s splash out more than £6K a year on their social lives - including impulse takeaways, rounds of shots and taxis

item.title: No wonder they can't afford a deposit! Under 35s splash out more than £6K a year on their social lives - including impulse takeaways, rounds of shots and taxis
item.description: New research confirms Brits are often spending more than their annual budget for socalising due to impulse buys and damaging expensive belongings. Almost all are in debt from their lifestyle.
item.content:encoded:
Millennials often report a struggle to save a deposit to get on the property ladder, but now research has revealed just how much they could save with smarter budgeting for their social lives.

A survey by sellmymobile.com has found that on average the nation's 18 to 35-year-olds go out twice a week with friends, spending £6,589 a year.

Most set a budget of £100 a week for socialising - amounting to £5,200 a year - but go well over this by £1,389 thanks to impulse purchases. 

These include impromptu spending on takeaways, lending money to friends without getting it back, rounds of shots and choosing taxis over public transport.

Almost 80 per cent revealed they often wake up with regrets over how much money they've spent, while 85 per cent agreed they could put their money to better use. 

And a massive 90 per cent admitted they were in debt because of their party lifestyle, with half lying to their partner about their spending.  

Young people could save up to £4,000 a year by going out once a week instead of twice, and cutting back their impulse spending. 

The research comes in the wake of another study found that half of the millennial generation could still be renting in their 40s.

Soaring house prices and stagnant wages means that saving a deposit is out of reach of many young people. 

The Resolution Foundation think-tank said that if home ownership growth in Britain follows the “weak pattern” of the 2000s, a third could still be renting by the time they claim their pensions.

Vix Leyton for sellmymobile.com said that budgeting is essential despite temptations to splurge.

She said: 'Sticking to it can be tough, particularly in the face of temptation, but when you see how much Brits are wasting and how many wake up scared to look at their statement, it's definitely worth trying.'

'It's not a shock that Brits make some questionable decisions when a drink has been taken, but those impulse rounds of shots and tipsy generosity, coupled with carelessness such as losing handbags and smashing phones can soon add up.' 

How much do Brits spend on nights out each year?

Official budget of £100 a week 

Plus impulse spending on 

Takeaways 

Rounds of shots   £174

Losing cash £192

Lending cash to friends 

Footing the bill for meals

Paying for everyone to get into a club

Splashing out on taxis rather than getting public transport  

 

£5,200 a year

 

£340 

£174 

£192 

£145 

£170 

£88 

£280 

TOTAL: £6,589
item.dc:abstract: New research confirms Brits are often spending more than their annual budget for socalising due to impulse buys and damaging expensive belongings. At least 90 per cent of the research participants claimed to be in debt as a result of their lifestyle. Despite an annual budget of £5,200, the average Brit spends a whopping £6,589 on boozy nights out.
item.dc:creator: Siofra Brennan
item.mi:shortTitle: How much do YOU spend on your social life?

item.title: Love Island fan's husband transforms their house into a VIP 'departure lounge' complete with cocktails, palm tree and a RED CARPET - so she can watch her favourite show in style
item.description: Nina Gibson, from Dorset, revealed how her husband transformed their home, plastering the walls of their living room with palm trees and catchphrases from the hit show like 'muggy' and 'melt'.
item.content:encoded:
Love Island fever has swept the nation once again as the cult reality show returned to ITV2 last night.

And one super-fan celebrated the beginning of series four in style thanks to the efforts of her husband, who surprised her by transforming their house into a Love Island-inspired VIP 'departure lounge', complete with cocktails, a palm tree and even a red carpet. 

Thrilled Nina Gibson, from Dorset, tweeted pictures of her home makeover - and praised her other half as the 'best hubby ever'. 

Nina said had no idea what her husband was up to, and only discovered his plot when she returned home to find a red carpet unfurled along the driveway outside their house.

She wrote on Twitter: 'When you come home to discover your husband has created you a VIP Love Island departure lounge, ready for 9pm! Suitcase full of goodies, a red carpet and control of the tv. 

'Legend #love #besthubbyever.'

Above her front door her husband had hung a sign that read 'VIP check-in', and a suitcase sat waiting for Nina with a flower garland wrapped around it.

Inside, the living room walls had been plastered with popular catchphrases from the show, like 'melt' and 'muggy'.

Her husband even went to the trouble of getting her novelty sunglasses with seashells around the lenses - and a tropical cocktail to enjoy was the icing on the cake. 

The romantic gesture has been liked hundreds of times on Twitter, with many people saying they were jealous of the effort Nina's husband went to.

Tagging their friends, one tweeted: 'We need to have words with our men!!'

'One of the best things I've ever seen... BEST. HUSBAND. EVER,' another posted.

A third said: 'My Boyf won’t even let me mention love island in his presence.'

'If my future husband doesn’t do this for me then I DO NOT want him!!!,' a fourth joked. 

It was even spotted by Love Island's forever popular voiceover man Iain Sterling, who also voiced his approval and said they deserved the prize money.

He said: 'Now this is a couple that could win themselves the £50k!'
item.dc:abstract: Nina Gibson (seen right), from Dorset, revealed how her husband secretly transformed their home to surprise her, plastering the walls of their living room with fake palm trees, flower garlands and catchphrases from the hit show like 'muggy' and 'melt'. The Love Island super fan, who only realised what he'd been up to when she returned home to find a red carpet unfurled on their driveway (seen left), tweeted that her other half was the 'best husband ever' (inset).
item.dc:creator: Kerry Mcdermott

item.title: M&S sends shoppers into a frenzy with a beauty box containing £135 worth of products for just £15 - and they're already on eBay for six times the price
item.description: M&S has released a summer beauty box with £135 worth of beauty products, including treats by luxury brands such as Origins, Nuxe and Ren when shoppers spend £40.
item.content:encoded:
In December beauty advent calendars containing hundreds of pounds worth of goodies for a fraction of the price had customers queuing around the block outside stores such as Liberty while 100,000 people joined a waiting list for No7's offering.

Now M&S has released a summer offering containing £135 worth of beauty products for just £15. 

Each box contains several full size products, including luxury brands such as Origins, Nuxe and Ren. 

The only catch is that shoppers have to spend £40 in store or online to get their hands on one for a bargain price. 

Some canny shoppers have already put their boxes, containing 15 products and a cosmetics bag up for sale on eBay, in the hope of making a profit.

One hopeful seller has listed theirs at £89 - almost six times the price, although most have been more conservative at £24 to £30.  

If you do get your hands on one it might be worth hanging on to, as the brand's 2017 beauty advent calendars are still up for sale on eBay for up to £130, despite originally costing just £35.   

Eager shoppers have been tweeting their love for the beauty box, with one admitting it makes her feel like she's 'truly living my fancy middle aged woman life'. 

Another said the summer essentials were the best yet from the brand.  

It's not the first time this season M&S has sent customers into a frenzy with a must-have purchase. 

A recent snap of a blue and white striped wrap dress on its fashion Instagram account prompted 5,000 likes and a flurry of requests from customers, even though it hadn't hit the shops yet. 

The post proved so popular that it garnered more likes than a photo shared of Meghan Markle wearing an M&S jumper. 

What's in the M&S Summer Beauty Box?

Autograph Sheer Radiance Eau De Parfum, 30ml 

Formula Ultimate Sleep Cream, 15ml

Color WOW Dream Coat Supernatural Hair Spray, 50ml 

Prai Ageless Throat & Décolletage Crème, 15ml 

EOS SPF Lip balm, 7g

This Works Deep Sleep Pillow Spray, 5ml 

Origins GinZing Gel Moisturiser, 30ml 

Percy & Reed Shine & Fragrance Mist, 75ml

Nuxe After-Sun Lotion, 50ml  

Philip Kingsley Coconut Breeze Elasticizer, 40ml

Ultrasun Lip Protection SPF 30, 4.8g

Pur Cosmetics Fully Charged Mascara, 4ml

REN Atlantic Kelp and Magnesium Body Wash, 100ml

M&S Cosmetic Bag

Autograph Lasting Colour Intense Liquid Lipstick, 6ml

Leighton Denny Nail Colour, 12ml 

Autograph Sheer Radiance Eau De Parfum, 30ml

item.title: Viewers in tears as heartbroken mother recalls the moment she learned her son had been stabbed to death over drugs on 24 Hours in Police Custody
item.description: Linda Cromwell, from Cambridge, became tearful as she recalled her son James' final hours in an emotional episode of 24 Hours in Police Custody on Monday night.
item.content:encoded:
Viewers were left in tears as a mother recalled the moment she was told her son had been stabbed to death.

Linda Cromwell, from Cambridge, became tearful as she recalled her son James' final hours in an emotional episode of 24 Hours in Police Custody on Monday night. 

James, 27, was fatally wounded by former schoolmate Abdul Korim Ali in an apparent confrontation over drugs near his mother's home in June last year. Ali was later found guilty of murder and was sentenced to life in prison in January.

Ms Cromwell said she first learned her son had been injured when his friend came to her door and said he was being resuscitated on a nearby street. She rushed to hospital where he was treated but was told nothing more could be done.

Viewers were moved to tears by the heart-wrenching scene, with one person saying they were 'bawling'. 

Ms Cromwell said she had last seen her son just hours before he was attacked. 

Recalling the moment she found out he had been hurt, she said: 'One of his friends knocked on the door and called me out and I was like ''oh god''. 

'I was worried about the noise. And he said: 'No Linda you need to listen to me, he's [James'] up the street and he's being resuscitated''. I didn't know what to do.'

James died from a single stab wound to the heart. Channel 4 cameras followed Bedfordshire Police as they tried to catch his killer in the 24 hours after his murder. 

Viewers watched as doctors, nurses and other medical staff crowded around James and tried to save him. 

Ms Cromwell continued: 'My partner give me a lift up to Addenbrooke's [Hospital] and basically they said they'd been working on him for quite a long time and done everything they could and he was dead.

'And I couldn't believe it, because I'd only seen him a few hours before [sic]. It was just a normal Friday and I met him through the back garden gate and we just passed like it was normal and he went off and I came back in.'

Viewers shared their support for Ms Cromwell on Twitter, saying it was 'such a sad story'. 

One wrote: 'Watching James' mum breaks my heart.' Another posted: 'Poor guy and his family :( Mus be so tough for everyone involved, from police to paramedics too.' 

Mr Cromwell and Ali had known each other since childhood. The attack broke out in an argument over drug supply.

Cambridge Crown Court heard the stabbing was a 'spontaneous act arising out of anger' and Mr Cromwell collapsed 'literally bleeding to death' in a nearby street. 

Mr Cromwell was held by his friend Shuhan Shahid as he lay dying. 

However the programme showed how Mr Shahid was initially reluctant to cooperate with the police to help catch Mr Cromwell's killer. 

DCI Adam Gallop, who lead the investigation, said on camera : 'Many witnesses will have split loyalties and may be motivated to not provide us with information.' 

It later transpired Mr Shahid was being intimidated by Ali's brother, Abdul Salam Ali, whom he knew as an acquaintance. He was being threatened with violence and had his car set on fire in a bid to silence him.  

Abdul Salam Ali went on to receive a three year prison sentence for witness intimidation.  

James's killer received a life sentence for murder and will serve at least 23 years in prison.
item.dc:abstract: Linda Cromwell (main), from Cambridge, became tearful as she recalled her son James' final hours in an emotional episode of 24 Hours in Police Custody on Monday night. James (inset with his mother), 27, was fatally wounded by former schoolmate Abdul Korim Ali in an apparent confrontation over drugs near his mother's home in June last year. Ali was later found guilty of murder and was sentenced to life in prison in January. Viewers were moved to tears by the heart-wrenching story, with one person saying they were 'bawling' (inset).

item.title: The perfect summer snack? Morrisons launches olives infused with GIN in time for picnic season (and they cost just £2.50)
item.description: Morrisons have teamed up with British gin brand Slingsby to create alcohol-infused olives. At £2.50 a packet, the snacks will prove popular with picnickers looking for something a little different.
item.content:encoded:
Morrisons has unveiled olives infused with gin just in time for summer.

The unusual treat will likely prove popular with shoppers looking to bring something a little different to their next picnic or barbecue.

A 150g packet is retailing for just £2.50 - making them a purse-friendly option for customers. 

The supermarket collaborated with artisan gin brand Slingsby to create the alcohol-infused snack.

They use pitted olives sourced from the Halkidiki region of Greece with the added zest of refreshing citrus flavours.

The olives arrived in store in last month ahead of World Gin Day on June 9. 

Morrisons recommends serving the olives with dips and other snacks. 

Waitrose previously sold pitted green olives in a gin, juniper and lemon zest dressing, listed at £1.99 for 100g, although they are currently sold out online.  

It comes after an expert caused outrage upon suggesting that G&T should be served without lemon and lime.

Sam Carter, a senior ambassador at Bombay Sapphire, told Business Insider that the citrus fruits add 'mustiness'.

He said: 'They're left for like a day and have gone brown on the edges and it just adds a real fusty, mustiness to it.

'Just because we did it 10, 20, 30 years ago and our parents did it, doesn't mean we have to do it.'

item.title: We have lift off! Pioneering breast implants made from material used in NASA space shuttles are 30 per cent lighter than traditional inserts
item.description: B-Lite implants, championed by plastic surgeon Dr Roberto Viel, use borosilicate glass, a material used in the heat shield that protected Nasa’s space shuttles during re-entry to earth.
item.content:encoded:
A 'revolutionary' new breast implant that harnesses NASA technology and is used on board the International Space Station has won over a legion of fans. 

B-Lite implants, championed by London-based plastic surgeon Dr Roberto Viel, use borosilicate glass, a strong but lightweight material used in the heat shield that protected Nasa's space shuttles during re-entry to earth.

Touted as 'the implants of the future', they are said to be not only 30 per cent lighter than traditional silicone implants, but also ripple-proof thanks to their reduced weight.

According to Dr. Viel, of the London Centre of Aesthetic Surgery (LCAS), they also have a shorter recovery time of as little as two weeks, while borosilicate makes sagging less likely. 

Scroll down for video 

Borosilicate glass also makes up the tiny microscopic balls (microspheres) found within the implants.

It is found in the windows on board the Cupola at the International Space Station. 

And now they have had the celebrity seal of approval, after Geordie Shore star Chloe Ferry had the implants inserted when she went under the knife on April 30.

The implants are used at LCAS, who say their reduced weight alleviates the strain on the body, lessening women's chance of developing back ache and making it easier to exercise comfortably.

Dr Viel explained: 'With a normal breast implant, the tissue surrounding the insert naturally lose their elasticity over time, making them increasingly susceptible to drooping.

'B-Lite, meanwhile, help to reduce any gravitational stress on the breast soft-tissue, as well as retaining shape and form in the long term.'

The implants use materials that are fully biocompatible, meaning they are safe to use in the human body.
item.dc:abstract: B-Lite implants, championed by plastic surgeon Dr Roberto Viel, use borosilicate glass, a material used in the heat shield that protected Nasa’s space shuttles during re-entry to earth (pictured: the Atlantis shuttle lifting off from the Kennedy Space Center). Touted as 'the implants of the future', they are said to be not only 30 per cent lighter than traditional silicone implants, but also ripple-proof thanks to their reduced weight.
item.dc:creator: Unity Blott
item.mi:shortTitle: High-tech breast implants use NASA space shuttle materials
