item.mi:shortTitle: Paul McKenna shares secrets to give you FREEDOM FROM EMOTIONAL EATING

item.title: Duchess of Diamonds: Meghan Markle has a sparkles collection of worth £1m after receiving some VERY expensive wedding gifts and a loan from the Queen
item.description: Before meeting Prince Harry, Meghan Markle stuck to modest trinkets. Now owns a collection of jewels worth £1m including her £140,000 engagement ring and a £241,000 Cartier bracelet.
item.content:encoded:
Before meeting Prince Harry, Meghan Markle stuck to modest trinkets. 

Now she owns a collection of jewels worth £1m.

This includes her stunning £140,000 engagement ring and a £241,000 Cartier bracelet.

Other dazzling items include the £450,000 tiara borrowed from the Queen.

A glittering set of £60,000 earrings she received as a pre-wedding gift also belong in her jaw dropping collection of jewels.

Here's how Duchess of diamonds, Meghan Markle sparkles.

ENGAGEMENT RING WITH DIANA’S JEWELS - £140,000

Personally designed by Harry and made by royal jeweller Cleave and Company, the Duchess’s engagement sparkler is by far the most magnificent in her collection.

Set on a gold band, the central diamond, believed to be around 3ct, was ethically sourced in Botswana — where the couple holidayed after only a few weeks of dating. The two round diamonds on either side come from a brooch that belonged to Harry’s late mother, Princess Diana.

In their blissfully happy engagement interview last November, Harry said the decision to incorporate Diana’s stones would ensure that ‘she’s with us on this crazy journey together’.

Leading jeweller David Marshall estimates the ring’s value at £140,000 — but High Street store Argos sells a cut-price version, the ‘Meghan Sparkle’, for just £14.99.

DRIPPING WITH DIAMONDS FOR HER A-LIST RECEPTION - £60,000

From the same collection as her jagged-edged wedding bracelet these Cartier chandelier earrings are made from 18ct white cold and are each set with 19 round diamonds totalling 0.81ct and ten rectangular stones totalling 1.08ct. All in all, that's 58 stunning sparklers dangling from Meghan's ears.

SWIRL STUDS TO BLING UP A BLACK DRESS - £1,350

Businesslike in black for a female empowerment event in London in April, Meghan chose these pretty diamond earrings made by Birks, her favourite Canadian jeweller, to jazz up her Jackie O-inspired pencil dress. The £1,350 studs, made from 18ct white gold and decorated with swirls of miniature diamonds, are ‘designed to enchant’. Much like everything Meghan wears, the earrings are now sold out on most retailers’ websites.

SIMPLE SILVER ROSES FOR A NEW DUCHESS - £1,395

For her first outing as a Duchess, at a Buckingham Palace garden party to mark Prince Charles’s 70th birthday last week, Meghan appeared to have acquired another new pair of dazzling diamonds. These Idylle La Rose earrings, by Belgian designer Vanessa Tugendhaft, are made from rhodium silver and paved with tiny diamonds totalling 0.43ct. They elegantly complemented her sleek chignon and jauntily angled Philip Treacy hat.

THE RING THAT’S A SIGN OF EVERLASTING LOVE - £1,130

Meghan loves symbolic jewellery — from the African bracelet that matched Harry’s, to the ‘H’ and ‘M’ necklace she wore early in their relationship. And this Infinie ring, from Vanessa Tugendhaft’s Promesse line, is a sign of everlasting love. She wore the piece, which is made from 18ct yellow gold and set with 0.25ct diamonds arranged in the shape of the mathematical symbol for infinity, to Belfast in March and again to the Invictus Games trials the following month.

THE CROSS TO MARK HER CONFIRMATION - £520

Days after she was baptised and confirmed by the Archbishop of Canterbury in March, Meghan began wearing this delicate diamond bracelet. it is believed to be a gift from the Royal Family for joining the Church of England, a pre-marriage requirement. The dainty piece, by Vanessa Tugendhaft, comprises an 18ct white gold chain with a central cross, set with 16 0.08ct diamonds. At just £520, it’s one of her cheaper pieces.

A GOLDEN CLOVER CHAIN FOR LOVE - £770

This minimalist necklace by Vanessa Tugendhaft was Meghan's lucky charm at the Invictus Games trial in April, adding some royal-worthy dazzle to her causal khaki coat. It features an 18ct gold chain set with solitaire diamonds and is intended to be worn day and night. 

ETHICAL GEMS TO GLAM UP A ROYAL OUTING - £450

The Duchess has worn Zofia Day’s triangle-shaped studs twice: once for her landmark interview with Vanity Fair in October 2017 and again for a royal outing in Cardiff in January. The Californian brand prides itself on ethically sourced stones. These £450 earrings are encrusted with 0.06ct diamonds.

HIDDEN SPARKLE ON HER WRIST - £995 

Dressed head-to-toe in navy for the Queen's birthday concert in April, Meghan couldn't resist adding some signature sparkle to her look. The piece, a silver and yellow gold bangle by edgy British designer Shaun Leane was subtly studded with diamonds totalling 0.13ct at one end.

ICE WITH A WINTRY THEME TO REMIND HER OF CANADA - £6,950

Smiling and relaxed in a chic, white shirt as she left Windsor Castle just days before her wedding, the soon-to-be Duchess didn’t miss her chance to shine, showing off this brand-new pair of 2.15ct diamond-studded white gold earrings.

Yet another design from Meghan’s favourite Canadian brand Birks, these Snowstorm earrings are said to be ‘inspired by the icy beauty of Canadian winters’ — perhaps not so apt for a sunny May day. At £6,950, they don’t come cheap — so Meghan made sure they were seen by sweeping her hair behind her ears.

GLITTERING PRE-WEDDING PRESENT SHE ADORES - £60,000

Meghan was first seen sporting these 18ct white gold Galanterie de Carier earrings in April at a reception to celebrate the Invictus Games, Harry's sports tournament for injured servicemen and women. She adores them so much she wore them again on her wedding day and they are believed to have been a pre-wedding present from Harry.

YET ANOTHER GIFT FROM HER BESOTTED GROOM? £17,700

Adorning her wrist at her new father-in-law’s birthday celebrations was this diamond tennis bracelet, believed to be another present from her Prince Charming.

Although the exact make is unknown, it looks remarkably like the £17,700 Cartier Essential Lines bracelet, made from 18ct white gold and set with 61 brilliant-cut diamonds.

If so, it would be a touching tribute to Diana, who adored Cartier jewellery and owned an almost identical piece.

A PRECIOUS CARTIER BRACELET FOR THE BRIDE - £241,000

Against the splendour of her Givenchy gown, her Reflection de Cartier bracelet almost went unnoticed. Made from 18ct white gold and set with more than 100 diamonds, it is designed to ‘create breathtaking radiance and light’. There are two versions of this bracelet, one costing a staggering £241,000 — but Meghan’s may well have been bespoke. 


THE STACKING RING SHE WEARS EVERYWHERE - £865

She’s flashed it out and about in Edinburgh and on stage in London for a charity event — this yellow gold and diamond ring, by her go-to Canadian jeweller Birks, is one of Meghan’s everyday staples. Costing £865, the band — made from her favourite metal — comes from the Birks Splash collection and is designed to be stacked; that is, worn on the same finger as several other rings.

Right on trend for this fashion-forward Duchess.

SUBTLE JEWELLED STUDS IMPORTED FROM INDIA - £375

These pared-down studs, by Los Angeles fine jeweller Adina Reyter, are made from a curved piece of 14ct yellow gold and feature a trio of 0.15ct diamonds. Called the Three Diamond Amigos, they cost £375 and are imported from India. Meghan chose the earrings for a Commonwealth Day service in March, adding a touch of flair — and sparkle — to her sensible white Amanda Wakeley coat and Stephen Jones beret. 

THE DAZZLING TIARA ON LOAN FROM THE QUEEN - £450,000

Every fairytale princess needs a tiara — and Meghan chose this spectacular piece, made for Queen Mary (the Queen’s grandmother) in 1932, for her big day. The stunning design, a band of 11 intricate sections, is made up of interlaced ovals and set with round-cut diamonds. In the centre is a detachable floral brooch made from ten glittering stones, a wedding present for Mary from the County of Lincoln in 1893. Both were bequeathed to the Queen on her grandmother’s death in 1953. The little-known piece was last seen in 1965, when it was worn by Princess Margaret. Leading jeweller David Marshall says: ‘This would be worth between £350,000 and £450,000. It would have taken up to 500 hours to make a tiara like this.’ 


SNOW-INSPIRED SPARKLERS FOR XMAS - £5,250 

Flying the flag once again for Canada — her adopted home from 2011 to 2017 — Meghan chose these Snowflake earrings by Birks for several festive engagements with the Royal Family last year, including the Queen’s Christmas lunch and a church outing in Sandringham on Christmas Day. The £5,250 earrings, designed to ‘capture the brilliance of freshly fallen snow’, are made from 18ct white gold and each feature two round-cut diamonds surrounded by a circle of smaller diamonds, totalling 1.39ct.
item.dc:abstract: Before meeting Prince Harry, Meghan Markle stuck to modest trinkets. Now she owns a collection of jewels worth £1m including her £140,000 engagement ring (top left) and a £241,000 Cartier bracelet (second left). Other dazzling items include the £450,000 tiara (main image) borrowed from the Queen and glittering £60,000 earrings (top right) she received as a pre-wedding gift.
item.dc:creator: Laura Forsyth
item.mi:shortTitle: Meghan Markle now has a collection of sparkles worth £1MILLION

item.title: I couldn't help but wonder... where are they now? As Sex and the City turns 20, FEMAIL reveals what its stars have done since - from political campaigns to BITTER public feuds
item.description: Two decades ago, on June 6, 1998, Sex and the City premiered on HBO, introducing Carrie Bradshaw, Charlotte York, Samantha Jones, and Miranda Hobbes to the world.
item.content:encoded:
I couldn't help but wonder—has it already been 20 years since Sex and the City premiered on television?  The answer, fans of the franchise might be surprised to learn, is yes.

Two decades ago, on June 6, 1998, Sex and the City premiered on HBO, introducing Carrie Bradshaw, Charlotte York, Samantha Jones, and Miranda Hobbes to the world. 

Actresses Sarah Jessica Parker, Kristin Davis, Kim Cattrall, and Cynthia Nixon immediately became household names. Since then, their careers have seen TV and movie roles, fashion collaborations, and even—in Cynthia's case—a pivot to politics. 

 

Sarah Jessica Parker 

When Sex and the City, based on the book of the same name by Candace Bushnell, debuted, viewers promptly became fascinated by the lives and adventures of the four main characters. 

The show, which was viewed by many as revolutionary for how freely it discussed female sexuality, has left a durable mark on pop culture, and it has become common to hear someone define themselves as either a Carrie, a Samantha, a Charlotte, or a Miranda.

All four actresses, of course, cemented Sex and the City's legacy by starring in the two movies derived from the show, released respectively in 2008 and 2010. 

 

Sarah Jessica, now 53, was 33 when the show premiered and playing the part of a fashion-loving columnist who tried to untangle her own love life through her writing, earned her four Golden Globes and an Emmy. 

Over the past two decades, the actress continued her career on the big and small screens, starring alongside Pierce Brosnan and Busy Philipps in the comedy I Don't Know How She Does It, back in 2011.

She has started her own production company, Pretty Matches, which produces content for HBO. Through the company, Sarah Jessica has produced the series Divorce, in which she plays the lead Frances Dufresne.

The show has run for two seasons, with the first one premiering earlier this year. It has so far not been officially renewed for a third run.

For many, SJP will always be Carrie, and in addition to her film work, the Ohio native who shares the character's passion for shoes, launched her own line of footwear in 2014, offering eye-catching designs from bright-colored stilettos to glittery boots. 

However, it was her apparent feud with co-star Kim Cattrall who played Samantha Jones on the show hit the headlines in early 2018 after SJP publicly hinted that someone previously involved in the show was responsible for halting production on a third Sex and the City movie.  

Speaking to Extra about the cancellation she said: 'I'm disappointed. We had this beautiful, funny, heartbreaking, joyful, very relatable script and story. 

'It's not just disappointing that we don't get to tell the story and have that experience, but more so for that audience that has been so vocal in wanting another movie.'

And she even jokingly offered the role to The Late Show host, Stephen Colbert, when she appeared on his show in January 2018. 

'There’s an opening,' she declared, alluding to the role of Samantha.  

Sarah Jessica, who was already married to her husband Matthew Broderick when Sex and the City premiered, has three children with him: a son named James, now 15, and eight-year-old twins Tabitha and Marion Loretta who were born via surrogate.  

 

Cynthia Nixon 

Cynthia, now 52, got her big break on Sex and the City aged 32. Since then, the actress and activist has had roles on television and on the big screen, before becoming involved in politics.

She won an Emmy for her role as Miranda in 2004, and she went on to win a second four years later for her portrayal of a woman dissociative identity disorder in a 2008 episode of 'Law and Order: Special Victims Unit.

Cynthia has also appeared in TV shows, 30 Rock in 2012, four episodes of Hannibal in 2014, and Broad City in 2016. 

In 2016, she played Emily Dickinson in the biographical movie A Quiet Passion, in which Jennifer Ehle portrayed Emily's sister Lavinia Dickinson. 

Cynthia is also an accomplished stage actress who has wont two Tony awards: one in 2006 for her performance in Rabbit Hole and more recently for her role as Birdie in The Little Foxes in 2017.  

She has even been awarded a Grammy for Best Spoken Word Album for her narration of the audiobook of Al Gore's An Inconvenient Truth.

Although she is only an Oscar away from the most coveted honor in all of Hollywood: the EGOT (Emmy, Grammy, Oscar, Tony), she has traded acting for politics.  

In March this year, the native New Yorker, who has long supported public education and women's health, announced her run as a candidate in the 2018 New York gubernatorial race.

She is currently a challenger to the Democratic incumbent Andrew Cuomo. Her only other adversary in the race so far is comedian Randy Credico, who has a history of entering elections as a perennial candidate.

Cynthia, who also campaigned in favor of marriage equality, was in a relationship with schoolteacher Danny Mozes from 1988 to 2003, but started dating her now-wife Christine Marinoni in 2004, two years after she first met her. 

The couple share a seven-year-old son named Max together, whom Christine gave birth to in 2011.

Cynthia also has two children, 21-year-old Samantha and 15-year-old Charles, from her relationship with Mozes.  

In October 2006, the actress was diagnosed with breast cancer during a routine mammogram and despite initially keeping the diagnosis private, she went public with her battle with the disease in April 2008 during an interview with Good Morning America. 

 

Kim Cattrall 

Kim, who was 42 when viewers first saw her in Sex and the City, also won a Golden Globe for her role on the show as Samantha Jones, an assertive, outspoken publicist.

Since then, much like her former co-stars, Kim has continued her acting career both on television and on the big screen.

She starred in Roman Polanski's The Ghost Writer in 2010, alongside Pierce Brosnan and Ewan McGregor.

The English-Canadian actress also played the lead in HBO Canada's Sensitive Skin, a black comedy series, from 2014 to 2016.

Sensitive Skin, in which Kim played a middle-aged woman grappling with aging, was canceled after two seasons.

The actress is now due to join the cast of the CBS All Access' Tell Me a Story, which reinvents classic fairy tales by giving them a dark psychological thriller twist, Variety reported.

However, in 2018 she made headlines after an off-screen feud with Sarah Jessica Parker was exposed.

Sources previously told DailyMail TV that a third Sex and the City movie was halted because Kim wanted Warner Bros to produce other movies she had in development.  

Kim later told Piers Morgan on Life Stories: 'This is really where I take to task the people from Sex and the City and specifically Sarah Jessica Parker in that I think she could have been nicer. I really think she could have been nicer. I don't know what her issue is, I never have.' 

She also admitted that she was never close with the other three co-stars: 'We’ve never been friends,' Cattrall said. 'We’ve been colleagues and in some way, it’s a very healthy place to be.'

Earlier this year, after Kim's brother passed away, Sarah offered her condolences, but Kim didn't want to hear them and wrote on her Instagram account: 'I don't need your love or support at this tragic time @sarahjessicaparker.'

Currently single, the British-born actress who grew up in Vancouver, Canada has been married three times but does not have any children. 

From 1998 to 2004 she was married to audio designer and jazz bassist Mark Levinson and the two co-wrote a sex manual entitled Satisfaction: The Art of the Female Orgasm together in 2002. 

In 2016 she publicly stated that playing the demanding role of Samantha Jones led to the breakdown of the relationship. 

'It cost me my marriage, because I was never home,' she told News.com.au.

 

Kristin Davis 

Kristin, who made her Sex and the City debut aged 33, is now 53 years old. 

Since then, the recovering alcoholic who has been sober since she became famous had a few roles in TV movies and shows, including the short-lived CBS comedy Bad Teacher, loosely based on the 2011 movie of the same name that had Cameron Diaz as its lead.

However, she has been more focused on charity work since her SATC days and in 2004 joined Oxfam International as a global ambassador. 

Like Charlotte, actress adopted a daughter, Gemma Rose Davis, now seven, back in 2011. She is rumored to have adopted another child, a son, earlier this month, though she hasn't officially confirmed the news.

And while she has had several short-lived liaisons with high profile men including actors Alex Baldwin, Damian Lewis and Steve Martin, she has never married and is currently single.  

In 2009, she helped rescue an abandoned baby elephant she encountered while on a safari in Africa.

She has since worked with the David Sheldrick Wildlife Trust, an elephant conservation organization based in Kenya. 

In 2015, Kristin acted as a producer of a documentary, titled Gardeners of Eden, which documents the trust's efforts to stop poachers and rescue orphaned elephants.

'Every 15 minutes, an elephant is killed for its tusks, which is a frightening, frightening statistic,' she told IndieWire at the time.

'If we don't do something, they'll be gone in 10 to 15 years from the wild. Through my work with the Trust, I started to learn about this. I didn't know that poaching was over.  

'I thought it was gone, done, not happening … I felt more and more impassioned, like there's a time clock ticking. I wanted to show people what I got to see.'

In 2012, Kristin made her Broadway debut in The Best Man, followed by her first time on the West End in 2014, when she landed the part of Beth Gallagher in Fatal Attraction. 

 

Chris Noth   

Chris, now 63, was 43 when he appeared in the pilot of Sex and The City. The actor played Carrie's on-and-off love interest John James 'Mr. Big' Preston throughout all six season of the series.

Before appearing on the show, he played a cop named Mike Logan on Law and Order from 1990 to 1995. After Sex and the City ended, he reprised his role on Law and Order: Criminal Intent from 2005 to 2008.

Chris also returned to the role of Mr. Big for the Sex and the City film in 2008 and its 2010 sequel. 

Although for some fans of the series the actor will always be Carrie's Mr. Big, he also had great success playing disgraced former state attorney Peter Florrick on The Good Wife from 2009 to 2016.

Over the past few years, he has had roles in the FX show Tyrant, which was cancelled in 2016 after three seasons, and the television mini-series Manhunt: Unabomber in 2017. 

He is currently playing Frank Booth on NBC's FBI procedural Gone. 

Chris and his wife Tara Lynn Wilson got married in 2012 after eight years of dating. The couple has one son, Orion Christopher Noth, who was born in 2008.

 

David Eigenberg

David played Miranda's main love interest Steve Brady, a bartender with a heart of gold. After a series of breakups and an accidental pregnancy on the series, Steve and Miranda eventually got married and raised their son together. 

The actor reprised his role as Miranda's husband Steve for both of the Sex and the City films, but he has been working steadily in television since the series ended.  

The now 54-year-old actor has appeared in one-off episodes of hit shows such as Without a Trace, Everwood, Judging Amy, NCIS, and Castle, among others. 

In 2012, he joined the cast of Chicago Fire, playing firefighter Christopher Herrmann. 

Like his Sex and the City character Steve, Christopher owns a bar on the show.

David also plays Christopher on Chicago Fire's sister show Chicago P.D. 

He and his wife Chrysti welcomed their first child, Louie Steven, in 2009. They also have a daughter Myrna Belle, who was born in 2014.

 

Evan Handler

Evan, now 57, became a Sex and the City fan-favorite after taking on the role of Charlotte's kindhearted divorce lawyer-turned-husband Harry Goldenblatt.

After appearing on the show for its last two seasons, he joined the Showtime series Californication in 2007, playing the main character Hank's best friend and agent Charlie until the show ended in 2014. 

While appearing on Californication, he reprised his role of Harry in both Sex and the City films.

Evan went on to play Duncan Porter on ABC's The Astronaut Wives Club in 2015, and a year later he was cast as Alan Dershowitz in American Crime Story: The People v. OJ Simpson.

In 2016, he appeared in the VH1 television movie The Breaks, and he reprised the role of Juggy a year later when the hip-hop drama was ordered to series.  

Evan recently appeared in a one-off episode of the CBS legal drama The Good Fight, which is a spin-off of his former co-star Chris Noth's series The Good Wife. 

The actor is also a writer and an author. His first memoir, Time On Fire: My Comedy of Terrors, is about his battle with acute myeloid leukemia in his mid-20s. His second, It's Only Temporary: The Good News and the Bad News of Being Alive, focuses on how he found gratitude after his illness.

Evan has also written for several magazines, including Elle and O, The Oprah Magazine, and he is a regular contributer to The Huffington Post. 

He was filming Sex and the City when he married his wife Elisa Atti in 2003. They welcomed a daughter, Sofia Clementina, in 2007. 

 

 Jason Lewis

Jason, now 46, was 31 when he took on the role of Samantha's young love interest Jerry 'Smith' Jerrod. 

When Samantha first meets him, he is a struggling actor named Jerry. She urges him to start using the stage name Smith, and through her PR connections she scores him a modeling gig that jump-starts his career.

Although she tries to keep their relationship casual, he works his way into her heart and became her most important romantic partner on the show.

Like Smith, Jason started out as a model in the nineties, walking the runway for the likes of Gucci and Tommy Hilfiger.

After the show ended, Jason appeared on Charmed in 2005, playing Phoebe's husband Dex Lawson. He has also had roles on House, Brothers & Sisters, and How I Met Your Mother.  

Jason reprised his role as Smith in both Sex and the City films. He is currently playing fallen angel Joe Strong in the NBC series Midnight, Texas, which was recently renewed for a second season. 

The actor made waves earlier this year when he weighed in on the feud between Sarah Jessica Parker and Kim Cattrall.

During an interview with KTLA 5, he was asked his former Sex and the City co-stars feud and he sided with Sarah. 

'If you can't say something nice don't say anything at all,' he said. 'Listen, I have to say that Sarah was always just so lovely and such a consummate professional and I think that people should remember their graciousness and the things that have been given to them.'

'And I'm gonna stop there because I've got nothing good to say,' he added.

When asked if he was on 'Team Sarah,' he replied: 'I might just have to say yeah.'

 

 John Corbett 

John's character Aidan Shaw captured Carrie's heart in season three of Sex and the City, and the two almost ended up getting married. 

Although Carrie ultimately ended up with Big, people are still debating whether or not Aidan was really the one for her. 

During his time on the show, the now 57-year-old was also a success on the big screen. He starred in My Big Fat Greek Wedding in 2002, and he also had roles in the films Raising Helen, Raise Your Voice, and Serendipity.

In 2010, he reprised his role as Aidan in Sex and the City 2, though he didn't appear in the first film, and he starred in My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2 in 2016. 

The actor has also had roles on popular TV shows, including United States of Tara, Parenthood, and Sex & Drugs & Rock & Roll. 

He recently played himself in the eighth and final season of Portlandia, which also starred Sex and the City alum Kyle MacLachlan.

In addition to acting, John has also released released two country music albums.

He has been in a relationship with actress and model Bo Derek since 2002.

 

 Kyle MacLachlan

Kyle, now 59, played Charlotte's first husband, Trey MacDougal, on the show. The two eventually got divorced, leading Charlotte to meet her second husband Harry.

After appearing on the series, Kyle went on to play mysterious dentist Orson Hodge in Desperate Housewives and the Captain in How I Met Your Mother. 

For 2011 to 2018, he played the Mayor of Portland, Oregon, in the comedy Portlandia. While filming the series, he took on the role of Calvin Zabo in Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. from 2014 to 2015. 

Long before he appeared on Sex and the City, Kyle was best known for his role as Special Agent Dale Cooper in Twin Peaks. He reprised his role for the show's reboot, which debuted in 2017.

In addition to acting, Kyle also co-owns the Washington-based wine label Pursued by Bear. 

Kyle met his wife, publicist Desirée Gruber, in 1999, and they got married in 2002. They have a son, Callum Lyon MacLachlan, who was born in 2008.

 

 Willie Garson

Willie, now 54, is known for playing Stanford Blatch—Carrie's gay best friend—on the series, and fans were just as invested in his search for love. 

The reoccurring character was Carrie's closest confidant aside from Miranda, Charlotte, and Samantha, and Willie reprised the role in both Sex and the City films.  

After the series ended, Willie starred on White Collar from 2009 to 2014. He has also guest appearances on Two and a Half Men, Girl Meets World, and 'Wizards of Waverly Place.'

From 2015 to 2018, he played Gerard Hirsch on Hawaii Five-0, and he recently appeared on the comedy series Conversations in L.A.

Willie was among those who publicly shared his disappointment over the cancellation of the third Sex and the City movie. 

Following reports that Kim Cattrall was behind the film being killed, Willie took to Twitter in October 2017 to suggest that his former co-star wasn't being entirely truthful when she claimed that she had never wanted to do a third movie. 

“Dear fans, because I’m ‘toxic’, I’m going to negotiate a contract for 6 months, not come to terms, then say I never wanted to do it anyway,” he wrote. 

'Dear fans, because I'm "toxic", I'm going to negotiate a contract for 6 months, not come to terms, then say I never wanted to do it anyway,' he wrote. 

Willie adopted a seven-year-old son Nathen in 2009.
item.dc:abstract: Two decades ago, on June 6, 1998, Sex and the City premiered on HBO, introducing Carrie Bradshaw, Charlotte York, Samantha Jones, and Miranda Hobbes to the world. Actresses Sarah Jessica Parker, Kristin Davis, Kim Cattrall, and Cynthia Nixon immediately became household names. Since then, their careers have seen TV and movie roles, fashion collaborations, and even—in Cynthia's case—a pivot to politics. The show, which was viewed as many as revolutionary for how freely it discussed female sexuality, has left a durable mark on pop culture, and it has become common to hear someone define themselves as either a Carrie, a Samantha, a Charlotte, or a Miranda. All four actresses, of course, cemented Sex and the City's legacy by starring in the two movies derived from the show, released respectively in 2008 and 2010.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Lankston
item.mi:shortTitle: Sex and the City: Where are they now?

item.title: Did they shrink in the wash? Social media users mercilessly mock the Cleveland Cavaliers' very CROPPED suit trousers - as LeBron James bucks the trend and wears a SHORTS suit
item.description: Players for the Cleveland Cavaliers made their pre-game entrance for Game 1 of the NBA finals in coordinated suits by Thom Browne. Some people have mocked them, and others think they're a jinx.
item.content:encoded:
Social media users are not impressed with the Cleveland Cavaliers' pre-game outfits — and not just because many see them as a jinx.

On Thursday night, the Cavs played in Game 1 of the NBA Finals against the Golden State Warriors, and turned up before the game in a series of coordinated suits.

But athletes have been known to make fashions statements, so these weren't just any suits: Many of them featured cropped trousers that ended above the ankle, while a couple of players — including superstar LeBron James — wore a suit with shorts. 

Scroll down for video 

The players were shown in photos and video before the game in their spiffy jackets, button-downs, ties, and oddly-short pants, quickly earning the attention of the internet.

Some of the trousers came up above the players' ankles, to nearly mid-shin, and were worn with high socks and dress shoes. And that's not just because each of these athletes is incredibly tall — the pants were actually designed to be that length.

LeBron had them all beat, wearing not suit pants but shorts cut above his knees. He, too, had high socks, dress shoes, a designer bag, and lots of jewelry, and wore his sunglasses inside — making it quite clear he was making a fashion statement.

But not everyone appreciated the message. 

'NOOOOOOOOOOO BURN THE SUITS,' wrote one Twitter user, commenting on a video that the Cavaliers posted. 

'Suit/Shorts ????? Is that a thing?' asked another, while another wrote: 'For a minute, I thought he had shrunk them in the dryer!'

'Those shorts with the high socks? ... this series is over,' added another critic, followed by one more who said simply, 'This ain’t okay lebron.'

Some of the problem, as the fans saw it, is that suits may be bad luck for the Cavaliers. When they've worn them while arriving before, they've lost games — but tend to win when they dress more casually.

'Matching suits...y’all already lost,' predicted a fan. 'NO! These suits are cancer. We're about to lose Game 1,' wrote another.

And sure enough, they did lose, with a final score of 114 compared to the Warriors' 124.

This isn't the first time that the Cavs have worn cropped suits. In April, the team — including LeBron, Tristan Thompson, and J.R. Smith — played the Indiana Pacers and showed up in suits by Thom Browne. 

Cropped suits are a signature of Browne's, and the team all went for matching ensembles. Dwyane Wade, who was traded to the Miami Heat in February, started the tradition, coordinating with the designer.

'Wouldn’t it be interesting if they all wore tailoring, and tailoring in a very uniform way, to really show the strength in a uniform?' Browne said of their first conversation, speaking to the New York Times.  

LeBron has continued it since Wade left, saying it gives the group a sense of 'camaraderie' and 'a feeling like we are one and in this together'.

Fans who think the suits are a jinx may be upset to learn that the team plans to continue to wear them for away games for the remainder of the postseason.

A week ago, GQ took a look at the team's wins and losses based on how they are dressed, and found they do in fact win a higher percentage of games when not in the Thom Browne suits. 

But the team seems to like the tradition. LeBron told the Times:  'We have the same outfit on every night when we warm up. Dressing the same isn’t special. Being in a designed suit by a master craftsman is truly special.' 

'Expressing myself through fashion is such an important part of my NBA experience,' he went on. 'It’s really another way to have fun and experience my love for the game. 

'I love mixing it up with my shoes on the court, sometimes at the podium post game. And of course there is the walk into the game. Using the tunnel walk to express yourself, say what you’re feeling — that is a very cool change my generation brought to the game.'

And coach Ty Lue isn't worried about what people think the suits mean for their record.

'I just think it shows a sign of unity, as one, everyone wearing the same suits,' he told USA Today. 'I mean, it's pretty cool. Like at first, when we lost our first game, we did it, and I knew it would be a story. But overall, it just stands for unity, like as one, going on the floor, having the same jersey and uniform on. I think it's pretty cool.'
item.dc:abstract: Players for the Cleveland Cavaliers made their pre-game entrance for Game 1 of the NBA finals in coordinated suits by Thom Browne. Most wore suits with cropped trousers that came up above their ankles. LeBron and Jordan Clarkson both wore suits with suit shorts. The team made headlines in May when they wore matching Thom Browne suits to a game. The tradition to wear matching suits was started by Dwyane Wade before he was traded and his now being spearheaded by LeBron.
item.dc:creator: Charlie Lankston
item.mi:shortTitle: LeBron James wore a shorts suit to Game 1 of the NBA Finals
